name: angleToMatchLengthX
summary: Returns the angle to match the given length for x.

schema.description: A sketch group is a collection of paths.

entityId.description: The plane id or face id of the sketch group.

id.description: The id of the sketch group.

on.description: What the sketch is on (can be a plane or a face).

xAxis.description: What should the plane’s X axis be?

yAxis.description: What should the plane’s Y axis be?

sketchGroupId.description: The original sketch group id of the object we are sketching on.

xAxis.description: What should the face’s X axis be?

yAxis.description: What should the face’s Y axis be?

position.description: The position of the sketch group.

rotation.description: The rotation of the sketch group base plane.

value.description: The paths in the sketch group.

oneOf.description: A path that goes to a point.
A arc that is tangential to the last path segment that goes to a point
A arc that is tangential to the last path segment

xAxis.description: The x-axis of the sketch group base plane in the 3D space

yAxis.description: The y-axis of the sketch group base plane in the 3D space

zAxis.description: The z-axis of the sketch group base plane in the 3D space

examples:
const part001 = startSketchOn('XY')
  |> startProfileAt([0, 0], %)
  |> line([1, 3.82], %, 'seg01')
  |> angledLineToX([
       -angleToMatchLengthX('seg01', 10, %),
       5
     ], %)
  |> close(%)

name: import
summary: Import a CAD file.
description:
For formats lacking unit data (STL, OBJ, PLY), the default import unit is millimeters. Otherwise you can specify the unit by passing in the options parameter. If you import a gltf file, we will try to find the bin file and import it as well.
Import paths are relative to the current project directory. This only works in the desktop app not in browser.

schema.description: Import format specifier

oneOf.description: Binary glTF 2.0. We refer to this as glTF since that is how our customers refer to it, but this can also import binary glTF (glb).

coords.description: Co-ordinate system of input data. Defaults to the [KittyCAD co-ordinate system.

forward.description: Axis the front face of a model looks along.

direction.description: Specifies which direction the axis is pointing.

up.description: Axis pointing up and away from a model.

direction.description: Specifies which direction the axis is pointing.

units.description: The units of the input data. This is very important for correct scaling and when calculating physics properties like mass, etc. Defaults to millimeters.

fn cube = (pos, scale) => {
  const sg = startSketchOn('XY')
  |> startProfileAt(pos, %)
  |> line([0, scale], %)
  |> line([scale, 0], %)
  |> line([0, -scale], %)
  |> close(%)
  |> extrude(scale, %)

  return sg
}

const box = cube([0, 0], 20)

const part001 = startSketchOn(box, "start")
  |> startProfileAt([0, 0], %)
  |> line([10, 10], %)
  |> line([20, 10], %, "edge1")
  |> close(%)
  |> extrude(20, %)
